law.catch_line: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated....

section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Abuse" means the non-therapeutic infliction of physical pain or injury, or any persistent course of conduct intended to produce or resulting in mental or emotional distress.
"Abuse" does not include the performance of an accepted medical procedure that a physician orders.
"Law enforcement agency" means the Department of State Police or a police agency of a county or municipal corporation.

A person who believes that a resident of a related institution has been abused shall report promptly the alleged abuse to an appropriate law enforcement agency, the Secretary, or the Department of Aging.

A report:
May be oral or written; and
Shall contain as much information as the reporter is able to provide.

The recipient of the report promptly shall notify:
The other parties referred to in paragraph (1) of this subsection; and
Unless the administrator is the alleged abuser, the administrator of the related institution.

text.section: Any employee of a related institution who is required to report alleged abuse under subsection (b) of this section, and who fails to report the alleged abuse within 3 days after learning of the alleged abuse, is liable for a civil penalty of not more than $1,000.

section.section:
Unless otherwise provided, the law enforcement agency, with the assistance of the Secretary, shall:
Investigate thoroughly each report of an alleged abuse; and
Attempt to insure the protection of the alleged victim.

The investigation shall include:
A determination of the nature, extent, and cause of the abuse;
The identity of the alleged abuser; and
Any other pertinent fact or matter.

text.section:
The law enforcement agency:
Shall refer to the Secretary for investigation reported instances of abuse involving any persistent course of conduct intended to produce or resulting in mental or emotional distress; and
May refer to the Secretary for investigation reported instances of patient-to-patient abuse.

Within 10 working days after the completion of an investigation under subsection (d) of this section, the Secretary shall submit a written report of its findings to:
The State's Attorney;
The local ombudsman as designated by the Secretary of Aging; and
Unless the administrator is the alleged abuser, the administrator of the related institution.

section.section: The Department shall provide each related institution with signs that set forth the reporting requirements under this section.
The related institution shall post the signs conspicuously in the employee and public areas of the related institution.
